subject: Character
point:
Don't let your life be barren. Be useful. Make yourself felt. Shine forth with the torch of your faith and your love.

With your apostolic life, wipe out the trail of filth and slime left by the corrupt sowers of hatred. And set aflame all the ways of the earth with the fire of Christ that you bear in your heart.

subject: Character
point: How I wish your bearing and conversation were such that, on seeing or hearing you, people would say: This man reads the life of Jesus Christ.

subject: Character
point: Maturity. Stop acting the child; drop that affectation that only suits a silly girl. Let your outward conduct reflect the peace and order of your soul.

subject: Character
point: Don't say: 'That's the way I'm made… it's my character'. It's your lack of character: Be a man.

subject: Character
point: Get used to saying No.

subject: Character
point: Turn your back on the tempter when he whispers in your ear: 'Why make life difficult for yourself?'

subject: Character
point:
Get rid of that 'small-town' outlook. Enlarge your heart till it becomes universal, 'catholic'.

Don't flutter about like a hen, when you can soar to the heights of an eagle.

subject: Character
point: Serenity. Why lose your temper if by doing so you offend God, annoy other people, upset yourself… and have to find it again in the end?

subject: Character
point: Say what you have just said, but in a different tone, without anger, and your argument will gain in strength and, above all, you won't offend God.

subject: Character
point: Never correct anyone while you are still indignant about a fault committed. Wait until the next day, or even longer. And then, calmly, and with a purer intention, make your reprimand. You will gain more by one friendly word than by a three-hour quarrel. Control your temper.

subject: Character
point:
Will-power. Energy. Example. What has to be done, is done… without hesitation, without more worrying.

Otherwise, Teresa of Avila would not have been Saint Teresa: nor Iñigo of Loyola, Saint Ignatius.

God and daring! 'We want Christ to reign!'

subject: Character
point: Let those very obstacles give you strength. God's grace will not fail you: 'Inter medium montium pertransibunt aquae! You shall pass through the mountains!' Does it matter that you have to curtail your activity for the moment if afterwards, like a spring which has been compressed, you will reach incomparably farther than you ever dreamed?

subject: Character
point: Get rid of those useless thoughts which, at best, are but a waste of time.

subject: Character
point: Don't waste your time and your energy ﻿—﻿ which belong to God ﻿—﻿ throwing stones at the dogs that bark at you on your way. Ignore them.

subject: Character
point: Don't put off your work until tomorrow.

subject: Character
point:
You a drifter? You… one of the crowd? You, who were born to be a leader!

There is no room among us for the lukewarm. Humble yourself and Christ will set you aflame again with the fire of Love.

subject: Character
point: Don't succumb to that disease of character whose symptoms are inconstancy in everything, thoughtlessness in action and speech scatter-brained ideas: superficiality, in short. Mark this well: unless you react in time ﻿—﻿ not tomorrow: now! ﻿—﻿ that superficiality which each day leads you to form those empty plans (plans 'so full of emptiness') will make of your life a dead and useless puppet.

subject: Character
point: You persist in being worldly, superficial, scatter-brained, because you are a coward. What is it but cowardice not to want to face yourself?

subject: Character
point: Will-power. A very important quality. Don't despise little things, for by the continual practice of denying yourself again and again in such things ﻿—﻿ which are never futile or trivial ﻿—﻿ with God's grace you will add strength and resilience to your character. In that way you will first become master of yourself, and then a guide, a chief, a leader: to compel and to urge and to inspire others, with your word, with your example, with your knowledge and with your power.

subject: Character
point:
It is inevitable that you should feel the rub of other people's characters against your own. After all, you are not a gold coin that everyone likes.

Besides, without that friction produced by contact with others, how would you ever lose those corners, those edges and projections ﻿—﻿ the imperfections and defects ﻿—﻿ of your character, and acquire the smooth and regular finish, the firm flexibility of charity, of perfection?

If your character and the characters of those who live with you were soft and sweet like sponge-cake you would never become a saint.

subject: Character
point:
Excuses. You will always find plenty if you want to avoid your obligations. What a profusion of well-thought-out nonsense!

Don't stop to consider it. Dismiss it and do your duty.

subject: Character
point: Be firm. Be virile. Be a man. And then… be a saint.

subject: Character
point: You say that you can't do more? Could it not be that… you can't do less?

subject: Character
point:
You are ambitious: for knowledge, for leadership, for great ventures.

Good. Very good. But let it be for Christ, for Love.

subject: Character
point: Don't argue. Arguing seldom brings light, for the light is quenched by passion.

subject: Character
point: Matrimony is a holy sacrament. When the time comes for you to receive it, ask your spiritual adviser or your confessor to suggest a suitable book. And you will be better prepared to bear worthily the burdens of the home.

subject: Character
point:
You laugh because I tell you that you have a 'vocation for marriage'? Well, you have just that: a vocation.

Commend yourself to the Archangel Raphael that he may keep you pure, as he did Tobias, until the end of the way.

subject: Character
point:
Marriage is for the soldiers and not for the General Staff of Christ's army. For, whereas food is a necessity for each individual, procreation is a necessity for the species only, not for the individual.

Longing for children? Children, many children, and a lasting trail of light we shall leave behind us if we sacrifice the selfishness of the flesh.

subject: Character
point:
The limited, miserable happiness of the egoist ﻿—﻿ who withdraws into his ivory tower, into his shell ﻿—﻿ is not difficult to attain in this world. But the happiness of the egoist is not lasting.

For this false semblance of heaven, are you going to forsake the happiness which will have no end?

subject: Character
point: You are too calculating. Don't tell me you are young. Youth gives all it can: it gives itself without reserve.

subject: Character
point:
Selfish. Always looking after yourself You seem incapable of feeling the fraternity of Christ. In those around you, you do not see brothers: you see stepping stones.

I can foresee your complete failure. And when you have fallen, you will want others to treat you with the charity you are not willing to show towards them.

subject: Character
point:
You will never be a leader if you see others only as stepping-stones to get ahead. You will be a leader if you are ambitious for the salvation of all mankind.

You can't turn your back on your fellow-men: you have to be anxious to make them happy.

subject: Character
point:
You never want to get to the heart of the matter. Sometimes, through politeness. Other times, most times, through fear of hurting yourself Sometimes again, through fear of hurting others. And, always, through fear!

As long as you are so afraid of the truth you will never be a man of sound judgment, a man of worth.

subject: Character
point: Don't be afraid of the truth, even though the truth may mean your death.

subject: Character
point:
I don't like your euphemistic habit of calling cowardice prudence.

For, as a result, God's enemies, with minds empty of ideas, will take advantage of your 'prudence' to acquire the name of learning and so reach positions that they never should attain.

subject: Character
point:
Yes, that abuse can be eradicated. It shows lack of character to let it continue as something hopeless, with no possible remedy.

Don't shirk your duty. Carry it out conscientiously, even though others neglect theirs.

subject: Character
point: You have a persuasive tongue. But in spite of all your talk, you cannot justify ﻿—﻿ by saying it was 'providential' ﻿—﻿ what has no justification.

subject: Character
point: Could it be true ﻿—﻿ no, no, I can't believe it ﻿—﻿ that in the world there are not men but bellies?

subject: Character
point: 'Pray that I may never be satisfied with what is easy.' I have prayed. Now it is up to you to carry out that fine resolution.

subject: Character
point: Faith, cheerfulness, optimism. But not the idiocy of closing one's eyes to reality.

subject: Character
point: What a 'profound' way of living a life of empty follies, of getting somewhere in the world: rising, always rising, simply by 'weighing little', having nothing inside, either in your head or in your heart.

subject: Character
point: Why that fitful character? When are you going to apply your will to something definite? Drop that craze for foundation-stones, and put the finishing touch to just one of your projects.

subject: Character
point:
Don't be so touchy. The least thing offends you. it's necessary to weigh one's words well before speaking to you even on the most

trivial matter.

Don't be annoyed if I tell you that you are… unbearable. Unless you change, you will never be of any use.

subject: Character
point: Give the polite excuse which christian charity and social convention demand. And then… on your way again! With holy shamelessness, without stopping until you have finally scaled the heights of duty.

subject: Character
point: Why are you hurt by what people say about you? How much worse you would be if God were to leave you. Persevere in doing good, and shrug your shoulders.

subject: Character
point: Don't you think that equality, as some people understand it, is synonymous with injustice?

subject: Character
point: That pose and that self-satisfied manner don't suit you at all: they are easily seen to be affected. Try, at least, to use them neither with God, nor with your Director, nor with your brothers: and between them and you there will be one barrier less.

subject: Character
point:
You lack strength of character: what insistence on having a hand in everything! You are bent on being the salt of every dish. And ﻿—﻿ you won't be annoyed if I speak clearly ﻿—﻿ you have little aptitude for being salt: in particular, you lack its capacity to dissolve and pass unnoticed.

You have too little spirit of sacrifice and too great a spirit of curiosity and ostentation.

subject: Character
point: Hold your tongue! Don't be childish, the caricature of a child: telltale, mischief-maker, little sneak! With your stories and tales you have chilled the glow of charity: you couldn't have done more harm, and if by any chance that wagging tongue of yours has shaken the walls of other people's perseverance, your own perseverance ceases to be a grace from God, for it has become a treacherous instrument of the enemy.

subject: Character
point: You are curious and inquisitive, prying and nosey. Are you not ashamed that even in your defects you are not much of a man? Be a man: and instead of poking into other people's lives seek to acquire a true knowledge of your own.

subject: Character
point: Your manly character ﻿—﻿ simple and straightforward ﻿—﻿ is oppressed when you find yourself entangled in gossip and mischievous talk, which you cannot understand and in which you never wished to be involved. Undergo the humiliation that such talk causes you and let the experience teach you greater discretion.

subject: Character
point: When judging other people, why do you put into your criticism the bitterness of your own failures?

subject: Character
point:
That critical spirit ﻿—﻿ I admit that there are no unworthy motives behind it ﻿—﻿ should not be exercised upon your apostolate, nor upon your brothers. I will speak plainly: that critical spirit is a great hindrance to the supernatural undertaking in which you are all engaged, for while you examine the work of the others ﻿—﻿ with the highest possible motives, I admit ﻿—﻿ without there being any reason why you should do so, you are not doing anything constructive, and furthermore by being negative you are holding up the progress of all.

'Then', you ask uneasily, 'that critical spirit which is the keynote my character…?'

Listen, I'll set your mind at ease. Take a pen and a sheet of paper. Write down simply and frankly ﻿—﻿ ah! and briefly ﻿—﻿ what is worrying you, hand the note to the person in charge, and think no more about it. He has the grace of state. He will file the note or he will throw it into the waste-paper basket. And, since the motives behind your criticism are not unworthy, since they are of the highest, it is all the same to you.

subject: Character
point: 'One must compromise' I Compromise is a word found only in the vocabulary of those who have no will to fight ﻿—﻿ the lazy, the cunning, the cowardly ﻿—﻿ for they consider themselves defeated before they start.

subject: Character
point: My dear man: though you feel very much a child, and though you are one before God, don't be so simple as to put your brother 'on the spot' before strangers.

subject: Guidance
point:
'They have the stuff of saints in them.' At times you hear this said of some people. Apart from the fact that the saints were not made of 'stuff, to have stuff is not sufficient.

A great spirit of obedience to your Director and great readiness to respond to grace are essential. For, if you don't allow God's grace and your Director to do their work, there will never appear the finished sculpture, Christ's image, into which the saintly man is fashioned.

And the 'stuff' of which we were speaking will be no more than a heap of shapeless matter, fit only for the fire…, for a good fire if it was good stuff!

subject: Guidance
point:
Get to know the holy Spirit, the great Stranger, on whom depends your sanctification.

Don't forget that you are God's temple. The Advocate is in the centre of your soul: listen to him and be docile to his inspirations.

subject: Guidance
point:
Don't hinder the work of the Paraclete: seek union with Christ so as to be purified, and feel with him the insults, the spits, and the blows, and the thorns, and the weight of the Cross…, and the nails tearing through your flesh, and the agony of a forsaken death.

And enter through our Lord's open side until you find sure refuge there in his wounded Heart.

subject: Guidance
point:
Here is a safe doctrine that I want you to know: one's own mind is a bad adviser, a poor pilot to steer the soul through the storms and tempests and among the reefs of the interior life.

That is why it is the will of God that the command of the ship be entrusted to a Master who, with his light and his knowledge, can guide us to a safe harbour.

subject: Guidance
point: Without an architect you wouldn't build a good house for your life on earth. How then, without a Director, can you hope to build the palace of your sanctification for your eternity in heaven?

subject: Guidance
point: When a layman sets himself up as an expert on morals he often goes astray: laymen can only be disciples.

subject: Guidance
point: A Director. You need one. So that you can give yourself to God, and give yourself fully…, by obedience. A Director who understands your apostolate, who knows what God wants, who can effectively second the work of the holy Spirit in your soul, without taking you from your place, filling you with peace, and teaching you how to make your work fruitful.

subject: Guidance
point:
You think you are quite important: your studies, your research work, your publications, your social standing, your name, your political activities, the positions you hold, your wealth… your age: you're no longer a child!…

Just because of all that, you, more than others, need a Director for your soul.

subject: Guidance
point: Don't hide from your Director those insinuations of the enemy. Your victory, on taking him into your confidence, brings you more grace from God. And moreover you now have what will help you to keep on conquering, your spiritual father's prayers and his gift of counsel.

subject: Guidance
point:
Why are you so reluctant to see yourself and to let your Director see you as you really are?

You will have won a great battle if you lose that fear of letting yourself be known.

subject: Guidance
point: A Priest ﻿—﻿ whoever he may be ﻿—﻿ is always another Christ.

subject: Guidance
point: Though you well know it, I shall remind you again that a Priest is 'another Christ'. And that the holy Spirit has said: 'Nolite tangere Christos meos ﻿—﻿ do not touch my Christs'.

subject: Guidance
point: Presbyter ﻿—﻿ Priest ﻿—﻿ means, literally, an elderly man. If old age deserves veneration, think how much more you ought to venerate the Priesthood.

subject: Guidance
point: It shows very little refinement ﻿—﻿ and great lack of respect ﻿—﻿ to make fun of a Priest, whoever he is, and whatever the pretext!

subject: Guidance
point: I repeat: to make fun of a Priest ﻿—﻿ no matter what the circumstances ﻿—﻿ is always, at best, a sign of coarseness and poor taste.

subject: Guidance
point: How we should admire sacerdotal purity! It is their treasure. No tyrant can ever wrest this crown from the Church.

subject: Guidance
point:
Don't place a Priest in peril of losing his dignity. It is a virtue which, without being pompous, he simply must have.

How that young cleric ﻿—﻿ a friend of ours ﻿—﻿ prayed for it: 'Lord, grant me… eighty years of dignity!'

Pray for it for the whole Priesthood, and you will have done a good thing.

subject: Guidance
point: It cut you to the heart to hear people say that you had spoken badly of those Priests. And I am glad that it hurt: for now I am sure you have the right spirit!

subject: Guidance
point: To love God and not venerate his Priests… is not possible.

subject: Guidance
point: Like the good sons of Noah, throw the mantle of charity over the defects you see in your father, the Priest.

subject: Guidance
point: Without a plan of life you will never have order.

subject: Guidance
point: This tying of one's life to a plan, to a timetable, you tell me, is so monotonous! And I answer: there is monotony because there is little Love.

subject: Guidance
point: If you don't get up at a fixed time you will never carry out your plan of life.

subject: Guidance
point: Virtue without order? Strange virtue!

subject: Guidance
point: When you bring order into your life your time will multiply, and then you will be able to give God more glory, by working more in his service.

subject: Prayer
point: Action is worth nothing without prayer: prayer grows in value with sacrifice.

subject: Prayer
point: First, prayer; then, atonement; in the third place, very much 'in the third place', action.

subject: Prayer
point: Prayer is the foundation of the spiritual edifice. Prayer is all-powerful.

subject: Prayer
point:
'Lord, teach us to pray!' ﻿—﻿ And our Lord replied: 'When you pray, say: Pater noster, qui es in coelis… Our Father who art in heaven…'

What importance we must attach to vocal prayer!

subject: Prayer
point:
Slowly. Consider what you are saying, to whom it is being said and by whom. For that hurried talk, without time for reflection, is just empty noise.

And with Saint Teresa, I will tell you that, however much you work your lips, I do not call it prayer.

subject: Prayer
point: Your prayer should be liturgical. How I would like to see you using the psalms and prayers from the missal, rather than private prayers of your own choice.

subject: Prayer
point:
'Not by bread alone does man live, but by every word that proceeds from the mouth of God', said our Lord. Bread and word! Host and prayer.

Otherwise, you will not live a supernatural life.

subject: Prayer
point:
You seek the company of friends who, with their conversation and affection, with their friendship, make the exile of this world more bearable for you. There is nothing wrong with that, although friends sometimes let you down.

But how is it you don't frequent daily with greater intensity the company, the conversation, of the great Friend, who never lets you down?

subject: Prayer
point:
'Mary chose the better part', we read in the holy Gospel. There she is, drinking in the words of the Master. Apparently idle, she is praying and loving. Then she accompanies Jesus in his preaching through towns and villages.

Without prayer, how difficult it is to accompany him!

subject: Prayer
point: You say that you don't know how to pray? Put yourself in the presence of God, and once you have said, 'Lord, I don't know how to pray!' rest assured that you have begun to do so.

subject: Prayer
point:
You write: 'To pray is to talk with God. But about what?' About what? About Him, about yourself: joys, sorrows, successes and failures, noble ambitions, daily worries, weaknesses! And acts of thanksgiving and petitions: and Love and reparation.

In a word: to get to know him and to get to know yourself: 'to get acquainted!'

subject: Prayer
point:
'Et in meditatione mea exardescit ignis. And in my meditation a fire shall flame out.' That is why you go to pray: to become a bonfire, a living flame giving heat and light.

So, when you are not able to go on, when you feel that your fire is dying out, if you cannot throw on it sweet﻿—﻿ smelling logs, throw on the branches and twigs of short vocal prayers and ejaculations, to keep the bonfire burning. And you will not have wasted your time.

subject: Prayer
point:
You are so conscious of your misery that you acknowledge yourself unworthy to be heard by God. But, what about the merits of Mary? And the wounds of your Lord? And… are you not a son of God?

Besides, he listens to you quoniam bonus… because he is good, because his mercy endures for ever.

subject: Prayer
point: He has become so small ﻿—﻿ you see: a Child-so that you can approach him with confidence.

subject: Prayer
point: 'In te, Domine, speravi: in thee, Lord, have I hoped.' And, with my human resources, I threw my prayer and my cross into the balance. And my hope was not vain, nor ever will be: 'Non confundar in aeternum! I shall never be disappointed!'

subject: Prayer
point:
It is Jesus who speaks: 'Amen I say to you: ask and you shall receive; seek and you shall find; knock and it shall be opened to you.'

Pray. In what human venture could you have greater guarantees of success?

subject: Prayer
point: You don't know what to say to our Lord in your prayer. You can't think of anything, and yet you would like to consult him on many things. Look: make some notes during the day of whatever you want to consider in the presence of God. And then take these notes with you to pray.

subject: Prayer
point: Next to the prayer of priests and of dedicated virgins, the prayer most pleasing to God is the prayer of children and that of the sick.

subject: Prayer
point: When you go to pray, let this be a firm resolution: Don't prolong your prayer because you find consolation in it or shorten it because you find it dry.

subject: Prayer
point: Don't tell Jesus that you want consolation in prayer. If he gives it to you, thank him. Tell him always that you want perseverance.

subject: Prayer
point: Persevere in prayer. Persevere, even when your efforts seem barren. Prayer is always fruitful.

subject: Prayer
point:
Your mind is sluggish: you try to collect your thoughts in God's presence, but it's useless: there's a complete blank.

Don't try to force yourself, and don't worry. Look: such moments are for your heart.

subject: Prayer
point: Engrave in your memory those words which struck you while praying, and repeat them slowly many times throughout the day.

subject: Prayer
point:
'He spent the whole night in prayer to God.' So Saint Luke tells of our Lord.

And you? How often have you persevered like that? Well, then…

subject: Prayer
point: If you don't keep in touch with Christ in prayer and in the Bread, how can you make him known to others?

subject: Prayer
point: I well understand you when you write: 'Every day I do my "few minutes" of prayer; if it weren't for that!…'

subject: Prayer
point: A saint, without prayer? I don't believe in such sanctity.

subject: Prayer
point: Plagiarising the words of another writer, I will tell you that your apostolic life is worth what your prayer is worth.

subject: Prayer
point: If you are not a man of prayer, I don't believe in the sincerity of your intentions when you say that you work for Christ.

subject: Prayer
point: You have told me sometimes that you are like a clock out of order, which strikes at the wrong moment: you feel cold, dry and arid at the time of your prayer, and on the other hand, when it is least to be expected, in the street, in the midst of your daily activities, in the bustle and hubbub of the city, or in the concentrated calm of your professional work, you find yourself praying… At the wrong moment? Possibly; but don't waste those chimes of your clock. The Spirit breathes where he will.

subject: Prayer
point: I had to smile at the impatience of your prayer. You were telling him: 'I don't want to grow old, Jesus… To have to wait so long to see you! Then, perhaps I won't have a heart as inflamed as mine is now. "Then" seems too late. Now, my union would be more ardent for I love you now with the pure Love of youth.'

subject: Prayer
point: I like to see you living that 'ambitious reparation'. The world! you say. ﻿—﻿ Very good, but first of all, the members of your supernatural family, your own relations, the people of your country.

subject: Prayer
point: You were saying to him: 'you mustn't trust me. But I…, I do trust you, Jesus. I abandon myself in your arms: there I leave all that is mine, my weaknesses!' And I think it is a good prayer.

subject: Prayer
point: The prayer of a Christian is never a monologue.

subject: Prayer
point:
'Minutes of silence'. Leave silence for those whose hearts are dry.

We Catholics, children of God, speak with our Father who is in heaven.

subject: Prayer
point: Don't neglect your spiritual reading. ﻿—﻿ Reading has made many saints.

subject: Prayer
point: You write. 'In my spiritual reading I build up a store of fuel. ﻿—﻿ It looks like a lifeless heap, but I often find that my memory, of its own accord, will draw from it material which fills my prayer with life and inflames my thanksgiving after Communion.'

subject: Holy purity
point: Holy purity is given by God when it is asked for with humility.

subject: Holy purity
point:
How beautiful is holy purity I But it is not holy, nor pleasing to God, if we separate it from charity.

Charity is the seed that will grow and yield rich fruit under the fertile rain of purity.

Without charity, purity is barren, and its sterile waters turn the soul into a swamp, into a cesspool from which rises the stench of pride.

subject: Holy purity
point:
'Purity?' they ask. And they smile. They are the very people who approach marriage with worn-out bodies and disillusioned minds.

I promise you a book ﻿—﻿ if God helps me ﻿—﻿ which perhaps I will call: 'Celibacy, Marriage and Purity.'

subject: Holy purity
point:
There is need for a crusade of manliness and purity to counteract and undo the savage work of those who think that man is a beast.

And that crusade is a matter for you.

subject: Holy purity
point: Many live like angels in the midst of the world. Why not you…?

subject: Holy purity
point: When you resolve firmly to lead a clean life, chastity will not be a burden for you: it will be a triumphal crown.

subject: Holy purity
point: You, a doctor, an apostle, write to me: 'We all know by experience that we can be chaste, living vigilantly, frequenting the sacraments and stamping out the first sparks of passion before the fire can spread. And it so happens that among the chaste are found the finest men in every way. And among the lustful predominate the timid, the selfish, the treacherous and the cruel ﻿—﻿ characters of little manliness.'

subject: Holy purity
point:
How I would like ﻿—﻿ you told me ﻿—﻿ the young apostle, John, would take me into his confidence and give me advice: and encourage me to acquire purity of heart.

If you really would like it, tell him so: and you will feel encouraged, and you will receive advice.

subject: Holy purity
point: Over-eating is the forerunner of impurity.

subject: Holy purity
point: Don't try to reason with concupiscence: scorn it.

subject: Holy purity
point: Decorum and modesty are younger brothers of purity.

subject: Holy purity
point: Without holy purity one cannot persevere in the apostolate.

subject: Holy purity
point: Remove, Jesus, that filthy crust of sensual corruption which covers my heart, so that I can feel and readily follow the touches of the Paraclete on my soul.

subject: Holy purity
point: Never speak of impure things or events, not even to lament them. Remember that such matter is stickier than pitch. Change the subject or, if that is not possible, continue with it, speaking of the need and the beauty of purity ﻿—﻿ a virtue of men who know the value of their souls.

subject: Holy purity
point: Don't show the cowardice of being 'brave'; take to your heels!

subject: Holy purity
point: The saints were not abnormal beings: cases to be studied by a 'modernistic' doctor. They were ﻿—﻿ they are ﻿—﻿ normal: of flesh, like yours. And they won.

subject: Holy purity
point:
'The flesh though dressed in silk'… This is my only comment when I see you waver before the temptation that hides its impurity under pretexts of art, of science…, of charity!

This is my only comment set in the words of an old proverb: 'The flesh is flesh though dressed in silk.'

subject: Holy purity
point: If you only knew what you are worth!… It is Saint Paul who tells you: you have been bought 'at a great price'. And he adds: 'That is why you should use your body for the glory of God'.

subject: Holy purity
point: When you have sought the company of a sensual satisfaction, what loneliness afterwards!

subject: Holy purity
point: And to think that for the satisfaction of a moment, which left in you dregs of bitterness, you have lost 'the way'!

subject: Holy purity
point: 'What a wretched man am I! Who will rescue me from this body doomed to death?' The cry is Saint Paul's. ﻿—﻿ Courage: he too had to fight.

subject: Holy purity
point: At the time of temptation think of the Love that awaits you in heaven: foster the virtue of hope ﻿—﻿ this is not a lack of generosity.

subject: Holy purity
point: Whatever happens, there is no need to worry as long as you don't consent. For only the will can open the door of the heart and let that corruption in.

subject: Holy purity
point:
You seem to hear a voice within you saying. 'That religious prejudice!' And then the eloquent defence of all the weaknesses of our poor fallen flesh: 'Its rights!'

When this happens, tell the enemy that there is a natural law and a law of God… and God! And also hell.

subject: Holy purity
point:
'Domine! ﻿—﻿ Lord ﻿—﻿ si vis, potes me mundare, ﻿—﻿ if thou wilt, thou canst make me clean.'

What a beautiful prayer for you to say often, with the faith of the poor leper, when there happens to you what God and you and I know! You will not have to wait long to hear the Master's reply: 'Volo, mundare! I will: be thou made clean!'

subject: Holy purity
point: To defend his purity, Saint Francis of Assisi rolled in the snow, Saint Benedict threw himself into a thorn bush, Saint Bernard plunged into an icy pond… You…, what have you done?

subject: Holy purity
point:
The spotless purity of John's whole life makes him strong before the Cross. The other apostles fly from Golgotha: he, with the Mother of Christ, remains.

Don't forget that purity strengthens and invigorates the character.

subject: Holy purity
point:
The battle front. A group of some twenty officers, singing together in gay and noble comradeship. The songs come quickly, one after another.

That young lieutenant with the brown moustache only heard the first:

'I have no use

for divided hearts:

I give mine whole,

and not in parts.'

'What reluctance to give my whole heart!' And his prayer rose up in a broad and peaceful flow.

subject: Heart
point:
You give me the impression that you are carrying your heart in your hands, as if you were offering goods for sale. Who wants it? If it takes no creature's fancy, you will come and give it to God.

Do you think that is how the saints acted?

subject: Heart
point: Creatures for you? Creatures for God: if for you, then let it be for God's sake.

subject: Heart
point: Why stoop to drink in the pools of worldly consolation when you can quench your thirst in waters that spring up into life everlasting.

subject: Heart
point: Detach yourself from people and things until you are stripped of them. For, says Pope Saint Gregory, the devil has nothing of his own in this world, and naked he comes to battle. If you go clothed to fight him, you will soon be pulled to the ground: for he will have something to catch you by.

subject: Heart
point: It's as if your guardian Angel were saying to you: 'You fill your heart with so much human attachment!… And that, then, is what you want your Guardian to guard!'

subject: Heart
point: Detachment. How hard it is! Oh, to be fastened by nothing but three nails and to have no more feeling in my flesh than the Cross I

subject: Heart
point:
Don't you feel that greater peace and closer union await you when you respond to that extraordinary grace which demands your total detachment?

Struggle for him, to please him: but strengthen your hope.

subject: Heart
point: Go, generously and like a child ask him: 'What can you mean to give me when. you ask me for "this"?'

subject: Heart
point:
You are afraid of becoming cold and distant towards everyone. For you want to be so detached!

There is no need to worry: if you belong to Christ ﻿—﻿ completely to Christ! ﻿—﻿ from him you will get fire, light and warmth for all men.

subject: Heart
point: Jesus isn't satisfied 'going halves': he wants the lot.

subject: Heart
point: You won't submit to the will of God… and yet you fall in with the will of the most insignificant creature!

subject: Heart
point: Surely there must be something wrong somewhere! If God gives himself to you, why are you so attached to creatures?

subject: Heart
point: So now it's tears! It hurts, doesn't it? Of course, man! It was meant to.

subject: Heart
point: Your heart weakens and you clutch at an earthly support. Very good: but take care that what you grasp to stop you from falling doesn't become a dead weight dragging you down, a chain enslaving you.

subject: Heart
point: Tell me: is that… a friendship, or is it a fetter?

subject: Heart
point: You are a squanderer of tenderness. And I tell you: charity towards your neighbour ﻿—﻿ yes, always. But ﻿—﻿ listen to me, apostolic soul ﻿—﻿ from Christ and for him alone is that other feeling which God himself has placed in your heart. Besides, isn't it a fact that the drawing back of any one of the bolts of your heart ﻿—﻿ and it needs seven of themhas more than once left a cloud of doubt floating on your supernatural horizon…, and, tormented in spite of the purity of your intentions, you asked yourself: haven't I perhaps gone too far in my outward show of affection?

subject: Heart
point: Put your heart aside. Duty comes first. But, when fulfilling your duty, put your heart into it. It helps.

subject: Heart
point:
If thy right eye scandalize thee, pluck it out and cast it from thee! Your poor heart, that's what scandalizes you!

Press it, squeeze it tight in your hands: give it no consolations. And when it asks for them, say to it slowly and with a noble compassion ﻿—﻿ in confidence, as it were: 'Heart, heart on the Cross, heart on the Cross!'

subject: Heart
point:
How is that heart of yours getting along? Don't worry: the saints ﻿—﻿ who were perfectly ordinary, normal beings like you and me ﻿—﻿ also felt those 'natural' inclinations. And if they had not felt them, their 'supernatural' reaction of keeping their heart ﻿—﻿ soul and body ﻿—﻿ for God, instead of giving it to creatures, would have had little merit.

That's why, once the way is seen, I think that the heart's weaknesses need be no obstacle for a determined soul, for a soul in love.

subject: Heart
point: You who for an earthly love have gone through so much, do you really believe that you love Christ when you are not willing ﻿—﻿ for him! ﻿—﻿ to suffer that humiliation?

subject: Heart
point:
You write: 'Father, I have a… toothache in my heart'. ﻿—﻿ I won't laugh, because I realize that you need a good dentist to do a few 'extractions' for you.

If only you were willing!…

subject: Heart
point: 'If only I had broken it off at the start!' you said. ﻿—﻿ Let us hope you haven't to repeat that tardy complaint.

subject: Heart
point: 'I was amused to hear you speak of the "account" that our Lord will demand of you. No, for none of you will he be a judge ﻿—﻿ in the harsh sense of the word; he will simply be Jesus.' These lines, written by a good bishop, have consoled more than one troubled heart, and could well console yours.

subject: Heart
point: Suffering overwhelms you because you take it like a coward. Meet it bravely, with a christian spirit: and you will regard it as a treasure.

subject: Heart
point:
How clear the way! How easily seen the obstacles! What good weapons to overcome them!… ﻿—﻿ And nevertheless, what side-tracking and what stumbling! Isn't it true?

That fine thread ﻿—﻿ that chain: that chain of wrought iron ﻿—﻿ of which you and I are conscious and which you don't want to break, that is what draws you from your way and makes you stumble and even fall.

Why do you hesitate? ﻿—﻿ Cut it… and advance!

subject: Heart
point: Surely God's Love is worth any love.

subject: Mortification
point: If you don't deny yourself you will never be a soul of prayer.

subject: Mortification
point: That joke, that witty remark held on the tip of your tongue; the cheerful smile for those who annoy you; that silence when you're unjustly accused; your friendly conversation with people whom you find boring and tactless; the daily effort to overlook one irritating detail or another in the persons who live with you… this, with perseverance, is indeed solid interior mortification.

subject: Mortification
point: Don't say: 'That person gets on my nerves.' Think: 'That person sanctifies me.'

subject: Mortification
point: No ideal becomes a reality without sacrifice. Deny yourself. It's so beautiful to be a victim !

subject: Mortification
point: How often you resolve to serve God in something, and you have to content yourself ﻿—﻿ you are so weak ﻿—﻿ with offering him the frustrated feeling of having failed to keep such a simple resolution !

subject: Mortification
point: Don't waste the opportunity of yielding your own judgment. It's hard…, but how pleasing it is in the eyes of God!

subject: Mortification
point: When you see a poor wooden Cross, alone, uncared-for, and of no value… and without its Crucified, don't forget that that Cross is your Cross: the Cross of each day, the hidden Cross, without splendour or consolation…, the Cross which is awaiting the Crucified it lacks: and that Crucified must be you.

subject: Mortification
point: Choose mortifications that don't mortify others.

subject: Mortification
point: Where there is no self-denial, there is no virtue.

subject: Mortification
point: Interior mortification. I don't believe in your interior self-denial if I see that you despise, that you do not practise, mortification of the senses.

subject: Mortification
point:
Let us drink to the last drop the chalice of pain in this poor present life. What does it matter to suffer for ten years, twenty, fifty… if afterwards there is heaven for ever, for ever… for ever?

And, above all ﻿—﻿ rather than because of the reward, propter retributionem ﻿—﻿ what does suffering matter if we suffer to console, to please God our Lord, in a spirit of reparation, united to him on his Cross; in a word: if we suffer for Love?…

subject: Mortification
point: The eyes! Through them many iniquities enter the soul. ﻿—﻿ What experiences like David's! ﻿—﻿ If you guard your sight you have assured the guard of your heart.

subject: Mortification
point: Why look around if you carry 'your world' within you?

subject: Mortification
point: The world admires only spectacular sacrifice, because it does not realize the value of sacrifice that is hidden and silent.

subject: Mortification
point: We must give ourselves in everything, we must deny ourselves in everything: the sacrifice must be a holocaust.

subject: Mortification
point: Paradox: to live we must die.

subject: Mortification
point: Remember that the heart is a traitor. Keep it locked with seven locks.

subject: Mortification
point: Anything that does not lead you to God is a hindrance. Root it out and throw it far from you.

subject: Mortification
point: A soul whose immediate superior was a rough and irritable type was moved by God to say: 'Thank you, my God, for this truly divine treasure: where could I find another who gives a kick for every kindness?'

subject: Mortification
point:
Conquer yourself each day from the very first moment, getting up on the dot, at a fixed time, without yielding a single minute to laziness.

If, with God's help, you conquer yourself, you will be well ahead for the rest of the day.

It's so discouraging to find oneself beaten at the first skirmish!

subject: Mortification
point: You always come out beaten. Propose to yourself, each time, the salvation of a particular soul, or its sanctification, or its vocation to the apostolate. If you do so, you are certain of victory.

subject: Mortification
point: Tender, soft, flabby…: that's not the way I want you. It's about time you got rid of that peculiar pity you feel for yourself

subject: Mortification
point: I will tell you which are man's treasures on earth so that you will appreciate them: hunger, thirst, heat, cold, pain, dishonour, poverty, loneliness, betrayal, slander, prison…

subject: Mortification
point: It has been well said that the soul and the body are two enemies who can't get away from one another, and two friends who cannot get along.

subject: Mortification
point: One has to give the body a little less than its due. Otherwise it turns traitor.

subject: Mortification
point: If they have witnessed your faults and weaknesses, will it matter if they witness your penance?

subject: Mortification
point: These are the ripe fruits of the mortified soul: tolerance and understanding for the defects of others; intolerance for one's own.

subject: Mortification
point: If the grain of wheat does not die, it remains unfruitful. Don't you want to be a grain of wheat, to die through mortification, and to yield a rich harvest? May Jesus bless your wheat-field!

subject: Mortification
point: You don't conquer yourself, you don't practise self﻿—﻿ denial, because you are proud. You lead a life of penance? Don't forget that pride is compatible with penance… Furthermore: your sorrow, after your falls, after your failures in generosity ﻿—﻿ is it true sorrow or is it the petty disappointment of seeing yourself so small and helpless? How far you are from Jesus if you are not humble…, even though your disciplines each day bring forth fresh roses!

subject: Mortification
point:
What a taste of gall and vinegar, of ash and aloes! What a dry and coated palate! And this physical feeling seems as nothing compared with that other bad taste, the one in your soul.

The fact is that 'more is being asked of you', and you can't bring yourself to give it. Humble yourself Would that bitter taste still remain in your flesh and your spirit if you did all that you could?

subject: Mortification
point: You are going to punish yourself voluntarily for your weakness and lack of generosity? Very good: but let it be a reasonable penance, imposed as it were, on an enemy who is at the same time your brother?

subject: Mortification
point: The joy of us poor men, even when it has supernatural motives, always leaves behind some taste of bitterness. What did you expect? Here on earth, suffering is the salt of life.

subject: Mortification
point: Many who would willingly let themselves be nailed to a Cross before the astonished gaze of a thousand onlookers cannot bear with a christian spirit the pinpricks of each day! Think, then, which is the more heroic.

subject: Mortification
point:
We were reading ﻿—﻿ you and I ﻿—﻿ the heroically ordinary life of that man of God. ﻿—﻿And we saw him struggle, for months and years (what 'accounts' he kept in his particular examination!), at breakfast time: today he won, tomorrow he was beaten… He noted: 'Didn't take butter…; did take butter!'

May we too ﻿—﻿ you and I ﻿—﻿ live our... 'butter tragedy'.

subject: Mortification
point: The heroic minute. It is the time fixed for getting up. Without hesitation: a supernatural reflection and… up! The heroic minute: here you have a mortification that strengthens your will and does no harm to your body.

subject: Mortification
point: Give thanks, as for a very special favour, for that holy abhorrence you feel for yourself.

subject: Penance
point: Let us bless pain. Love pain. Sanctify pain… Glorify pain!

subject: Penance
point: A whole programme for a good course in the 'subject' of suffering is given to us by the Apostle: spe gaudentes ﻿—﻿ rejoicing in hope, In tribulatione patientes ﻿—﻿ patient in troubles, orationi instantes ﻿—﻿ persevering in prayer.

subject: Penance
point: Atonement: this is the path that leads to Life.

subject: Penance
point:
In the deep pit opened by your humility, let penance bury your negligences, offences and sins. Just as the gardener buries rotten fruit, dried twigs and fallen leaves at the foot of the very trees which produced them. And so what was useless, what was even harmful, can make a real contribution to a new fruitfulness.

From the falls learn to draw strength: from death, life.

subject: Penance
point: That Christ you see is not Jesus. It is only the pitiful image that your blurred eyes are able to form… ﻿—﻿ Purify yourself. Clarify your sight with humility and penance. Then… the pure light of Love will not be denied you. And you will have perfect vision. The image you see will be really his: his!

subject: Penance
point: Jesus suffers to carry out the will of the Father. And you, who also want to carry out the most holy Will of God, following the steps of the Master, can you complain if you meet suffering on your way?

subject: Penance
point: Say to your body: I would rather keep you in slavery than be myself a slave of yours.

subject: Penance
point: How afraid people are of atonement! If all that they do for appearance's sake, to please the world, were done with purified intention for God… what saints many would be!

subject: Penance
point: You are crying? Don't be ashamed of it. Yes, cry: men also cry like you, when they are alone and before God. Each night, says King David, I soak my bed with tears. With those tears, those burning, manly tears, you can purify your past and supernaturalize your present life.

subject: Penance
point: I want you to be happy on earth. And you will not be happy if you don't lose that fear of suffering. For, as long as we are 'wayfarers', it is precisely in suffering that our happiness lies.

subject: Penance
point: How beautiful it is to give up this life for that Life!

subject: Penance
point: If you realize that those sufferings ﻿—﻿ of body or soul ﻿—﻿ mean purification and merit, bless them.

subject: Penance
point: 'God give you health.' ﻿—﻿ Doesn't this wish for mere physical well-being, with which some beggars demand or acknowledge alms, leave a bad taste in your mouth?

subject: Penance
point: If we are generous in voluntary atonement Jesus will fill us with grace to love the trials he sends us.

subject: Penance
point: Let your will exact from your senses, by means of atonement, what your other faculties deny your will in prayer.

subject: Penance
point: Of how little value is penance without constant self﻿—﻿ denial!

subject: Penance
point: You are afraid of penance?… Of penance, which will help you to obtain Life everlasting. And yet, in order to preserve this poor present life, don't you see how men will submit to all the cruel torture of a surgical operation?

subject: Penance
point: Your greatest enemy is your own self.

subject: Penance
point: Treat your body with charity, but with no more charity than you would show towards a treacherous enemy.

subject: Penance
point: If you realize that your body is your enemy, and an enemy of God's glory, since it is an enemy of your sanctification, why do you treat it so softly?

subject: Penance
point: 'Have a good time to-night', they said, as usual. And the comment of a soul very close to God was, 'What a limited wish!'

subject: Penance
point: With you, Jesus, what joy in suffering, what light in darkness!

subject: Penance
point: You are suffering! Listen: 'His' Heart is not smaller than ours. ﻿—﻿ You are suffering? There is good in suffering.

subject: Penance
point: A strict fast is a penance most pleasing to God. But, what with one thing and another, we have become a bit too easy-going. There is no objection ﻿—﻿ on the contrary ﻿—﻿ if you, with the approval of your Director, fast frequently.

subject: Penance
point: Motives for penance? ﻿—﻿ Atonement, reparation, petition, thanksgiving: means to progress: for you, for me, for others, for your family, for your country, for the Church… And a thousand motives more.

subject: Penance
point: Don't do more penance than your Director allows you.

subject: Penance
point: How we ennoble suffering, giving it its right place (atonement) in the spiritual order!

subject: Examination of conscience
point:
Examination of conscience: a daily task. Book-keeping is never neglected by anyone in business.

And is there any business worth more than the business of eternal life?

subject: Examination of conscience
point: At the time of examination beware of the devil that ties your tongue.

subject: Examination of conscience
point: Examine yourself: slowly, courageously. Is it not true that your bad humour and your gloominess, both without cause ﻿—﻿ without apparent cause ﻿—﻿ are due to your lack of determination in breaking the subtle but real snares laid for you ﻿—﻿ cunningly and attractively ﻿—﻿ by your concupiscence?

subject: Examination of conscience
point: The general examination implies defence. The particular, attack. The first is your armour. The second, your sword.

subject: Examination of conscience
point: Looking back on the past. To bewail it? No: that would be useless. ﻿—﻿ To learn: that is fruitful.

subject: Examination of conscience
point: Ask for light. Keep on asking, until the root is laid bare and you can get at it with your battle-axe, the particular examination.

subject: Examination of conscience
point: Your particular examination should be directed towards the acquisition of a definite virtue or the rooting out of your predominant defect.

subject: Examination of conscience
point:
'What I owe to God as a Christian! My failure to respond to God's grace, in the face of that debt, has made me weep with sorrow; with Love-sorrow. Mea culpa!

It is good that you acknowledge your debts; but don't forget how they are paid: with tears… and with deeds.

subject: Examination of conscience
point: 'He who is faithful in little things is faithful also in big things.' Words from Saint Luke that show you ﻿—﻿ examine yourself ﻿—﻿ why you have so often gone astray.

subject: Examination of conscience
point: React. Listen to what the holy Spirit tells you: 'If it were an enemy who insulted me, I could put up with that. But you… tu vero homo unanimis, dux meus, et notus meus, ﻿—﻿ you, my friend, my apostle, who sit at my table and take sweet food with me!

subject: Examination of conscience
point: On days of recollection your examination of conscience should be more searching than the usual nightly moment. Otherwise you miss a great chance to put things right.

subject: Examination of conscience
point: Always end your examination with an act of Love ﻿—﻿ of Love-sorrow: for yourself, for all the sins of men. And consider the fatherly care of God in removing the obstacles in your way lest you stumble.

subject: Resolutions
point: Be definite. Don't let your resolutions be like fireworks that sparkle for a moment, to leave behind as hard reality a blackened, useless stub that one throws disgustedly away.

subject: Resolutions
point: You are so young! To me you are like a ship setting out on its voyage. If that slight deviation of to-day is left uncorrected, you will never reach port in the end.

subject: Resolutions
point: Make few resolutions. Make them definite. ﻿—﻿ And fulfil them with the help of God.

subject: Resolutions
point: I listened in silence as you said, 'Yes, I want to be a saint.' Though usually such a vague and general statement seems nonsense to me.

subject: Resolutions
point: 'To-morrow': sometimes it is prudence; very often it is the adverb of the defeated.

subject: Resolutions
point:
Make this firm and determined resolution: to recall, when you receive honours and praise, all that brings a blush of shame to your cheek.

The shame is yours; the praise and glory, God's.

subject: Resolutions
point: Do your duty 'now', without looking back on 'yesterday', which has already passed, or worrying over 'to-morrow', which may never come for you.

subject: Resolutions
point: Now! Return to your noble life now. Don't be a fool: 'now' is not too soon… nor too late.

subject: Resolutions
point:
You want to hear all that I think of 'your way'? Very well, then…, listen: if you respond to the call, you will do your utmost in your work for Christ: if you become a man of prayer, you will be granted the grace necessary to respond and, hungry for sacrifice, you will seek out the hardest tasks…

And you will be happy here, and unspeakably happy hereafter.

subject: Resolutions
point: That is a painful wound. But it is well on its way to being healed. Stick to your resolutions. And the pain will soon turn into Joyful peace.

subject: Resolutions
point: You drag along like a dead-weight, as if you had no part to play. No wonder you are beginning to feel the symptoms of lukewarmness. Wake up!

subject: Scruples
point:
Get rid of those scruples that deprive you of peace. ﻿—﻿ What takes away your peace of soul cannot come from God.

When God comes to you, you will feel the truth of those greetings: My peace I give to you…, peace I leave you…, peace be with you…, and you will feel it even in the midst of troubles.

subject: Scruples
point:
Those scruples still! Speak simply and clearly to your Director.

Obey… and don't underestimate the most loving Heart of our Lord.

subject: Scruples
point:
Gloominess, depression. I am not surprised: it is the cloud of dust raised by your fall. But… that's enough! Can't you see that the cloud has been borne far away by the breath of grace?

Moreover, your gloominess, if you don't fight it, could very well be the cloak of your pride. ﻿—﻿ Did you really think yourself perfect and incapable of sinning?

subject: Scruples
point: I forbid you to think any more about it. ﻿—﻿ Instead, bless God, who has given back life to your soul.

subject: Scruples
point: Stop thinking of your fall. That thought, besides overwhelming and crushing you under its weight, may easily be an occasion of further temptations. Christ has forgiven you: forget the 'old self'.

subject: Scruples
point: Don't lose heart. I have seen you struggle: to-day's defeat is training for the final victory.

subject: Scruples
point: You've done well…, even though you have fallen so low. You have done well, because you humbled yourself, because you put things right, because you filled yourself with hope, and that hope brought you back again to his Love. Don't look so amazed: you have done well! You rose up from the ground: 'Surge ﻿—﻿ arise,' the mighty voice cried anew, 'et ambula! ﻿—﻿ and walk!' Now ﻿—﻿ to work!

subject: Presence of God
point:
Children… How they seek to behave worthily in the presence of their parents.

And the children of kings, in the presence of their father the king, how they seek to uphold the royal dignity!

And you? ﻿—﻿ Don't you realize that you are always in the presence of the great King, God, your Father?

subject: Presence of God
point: Never make a decision without stopping to consider the matter in the presence of God.

subject: Presence of God
point:
We've got to be convinced that God is always near us. We live as though he were far away, in the heavens high above, and we forget that he is also continually by our side.

He is there like a loving Father. He loves each one of us more than all the mothers in the world can love their children ﻿—﻿ helping us, inspiring us, blessing… and forgiving.

How often we have misbehaved and then cleared the frowns from our parents' brows, telling them: I won't do it any more! ﻿—﻿ That same day, perhaps, we fall again… ﻿—﻿ And our father, with feigned harshness in his voice and serious face, reprimands us, while in his heart he is moved, realizing our weakness and thinking: poor child, how hard he tries to behave well!

We've got to be filled, to be imbued with the idea that our Father, and very much our Father, is God who is both near us and in heaven.

subject: Presence of God
point:
Get used to lifting your heart to God, in acts of thanksgiving, many times a day. Because he gives you this and that. Because you have been despised. Because you haven't what you need or because you have.

Because he made his Mother so beautiful, his Mother who is also your Mother. Because he created the sun and the moon and this animal and that plant. Because he made that man eloquent and you he left tongue-tied…

Thank him for everything, because everything is good.

subject: Presence of God
point:
Don't be so blind or so thoughtless as not to enter inside each Tabernacle when you glimpse the walls or spires of the houses of God. He is waiting for you.

Don't be so blind or so thoughtless as not to invoke Mary Immaculate with an ejaculation at least, whenever you pass near those places where you know that Christ is offended.

subject: Presence of God
point: As you make your way through the familiar streets of the city, have you never had the joy of discovering… another Tabernacle?

subject: Presence of God
point: A saying of a soul of prayer: in intentions, may Jesus be our aim; in affections, our Love; in conversation, our theme; in actions, our model.

subject: Presence of God
point: Make use of those holy 'human devices' that I suggested to help you keep presence of God: ejaculations, acts of love and reparation, spiritual Communions, 'glances' at a picture of our Lady.

subject: Presence of God
point: Alone! You are not alone. We are keeping you close company from afar. Besides…, the holy Spirit, living in your soul in grace ﻿—﻿ God with you, ﻿—﻿ is giving a supernatural tone to all your thoughts, desires and actions.

subject: Presence of God
point:
'Father', said that big fellow, a good student at the university (I wonder what has become of him), 'I was thinking of what you told me ﻿—﻿ that I'm a son of God! ﻿—﻿ and I found myself walking along the street, head up, chin out, and a proud feeling inside… a son of God!'

With sure conscience I advised him to encourage that 'pride.'

subject: Presence of God
point: I don't doubt your good intentions. I know that you act in the presence of God. But (and there is a 'but'), your actions are witnessed or may be witnessed by men who judge by human standards… And you must give them good example.

subject: Presence of God
point: If you accustom yourself, even only once a week, to seek union with Mary in order to go to Jesus, you will see how you have more presence of God.

subject: Presence of God
point: You ask me: why that wooden Cross? ﻿—﻿ And I copy from a letter: 'As I look up from the microscope, my sight comes to rest on the cross ﻿—﻿ black and empty. That Cross without its Crucified is a symbol. It has a meaning which others cannot see. And though I am tired out and on the point of abandoning the job, I once again bring my eyes to the lens and continue: for the lonely Cross is calling for a pair of shoulders to bear it.'

subject: Presence of God
point: Live in the presence of God and you will have supernatural life.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Most people have a plane-like vision, stuck to the earth, of two dimensions. When you live a supernatural life, God will give you the third dimension: height, and with it, perspective, weight and volume.

subject: Supernatural life
point: If you lose the supernatural meaning of your life, your charity will be philanthropy; your purity, decency; your mortification, stupidity; your discipline, a whip; and all your works, fruitless.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Silence is the door-keeper of the interior life.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Paradox: sanctity is more attainable than learning, but it is easier to be learned than to be a saint.

subject: Supernatural life
point:
A change! You say you need a change!… opening your eyes wide so as to take in better the images of things, or almost closing them because you are short-sighted.

Close them altogether! Have interior life, and you will see, in undreamt-of colour and relief, the wonders of a better world, of a new world: and you will draw close to God…, and know your weakness…, and be deified… with a deification which, by bringing you nearer to your Father, will make you more a brother of your fellow-men.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Ambition: to be good myself, and to see everyone else better than I.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Conversion is the matter of a moment. Sanctification is the work of a lifetime.

subject: Supernatural life
point: There is nothing better in the world than to be in the grace of God.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Purity of intention. You will have it always if, always and in everything, you seek only to please God.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Enter into the wounds of Christ Crucified. There you will learn to guard your senses, you will have interior life, and you will continually offer to the Father the sufferings of our Lord and those of Mary, in payment of your debts and the debts of all men.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Your holy impatience to serve him does not displease God. But it will be fruitless if it is not accompanied by a real improvement in your daily conduct.

subject: Supernatural life
point: To rectify. A little each day. ﻿—﻿ This must be your constant concern if you really want to become a saint.

subject: Supernatural life
point:
Your duty is to sanctify yourself. Yes, even you. Who thinks that this task is only for priests and religious?

To everyone, without exception, our Lord said: 'Be ye perfect, as my heavenly Father is perfect.'

subject: Supernatural life
point: Your interior life has to be just that: to begin… and to begin again.

subject: Supernatural life
point: In your interior life, have you slowly considered the beauty of 'serving' with ever-renewed willingness?

subject: Supernatural life
point:
The plants lay hidden under the snow. And the farmer, the owner of the land, observed with satisfaction: 'Now they are growing on the inside.'

I thought of you: of your forced inactivity…

Tell me: are you too growing 'on the inside'?

subject: Supernatural life
point: If you are not master of yourself ﻿—﻿ though you may be powerful ﻿—﻿ your air of mastery moves me to pity and laughter.

subject: Supernatural life
point:
It is hard to read that question of Pilate's in the holy Gospel: 'Whom do you wish me to release to you, Barabbas, or Jesus, who is called Christ?' ﻿—﻿ It is more painful to hear the answer: 'Barabbas!'

And more terrible still when I realize that very often by going astray I too have said 'Barabbas!' and added 'Christ?… Crucify him!'

subject: Supernatural life
point: All that, which worries you for the moment, is of relative importance. What is of absolute importance is that you be happy, that you be saved.

subject: Supernatural life
point:
New lights! What joy you feel that God has let you 'discover' an old discovery!

Make the most of the occasion: it is the moment to break into a hymn of thanksgiving: it is also the moment to clean up odd corners of your soul, to get out of some rut, to act more supernaturally, to avoid giving bad example to your neighbour.

In a word: let your gratitude show itself in some concrete resolution.

subject: Supernatural life
point: Christ has died for you. ﻿—﻿ You… what ought you do for Christ?…

subject: Supernatural life
point: Your personal experience ﻿—﻿ those feelings of restlessness, despondency and bitterness ﻿—﻿ makes you realise the truth of those words of Jesus: no one can serve two masters!

subject: More about interior life
point:
A secret, an open secret: these world crises are crises of saints.

God wants a handful of men 'of his own' in every human activity. And then… 'pax Christi in regno Christi ﻿—﻿ the peace of Christ in the kingdom of Christ'.

subject: More about interior life
point: Your Crucifix. ﻿—﻿ As a Christian, you should always carry your Crucifix with you. And place it on your desk. And kiss it before going to bed and when you wake up: and when your poor body rebels against your soul, kiss it again.

subject: More about interior life
point: Don't be afraid to call our Lord by his name ﻿—﻿ Jesus ﻿—﻿ and to tell him that you love him.

subject: More about interior life
point: Each day try to find a few minutes of that blessed solitude which you so much need to keep your interior life going.

subject: More about interior life
point:
You write: 'Simplicity is the salt of perfection. And that's what I lack. I want to acquire it, with his help and with yours.'

Neither his nor mine will fail you. ﻿—﻿ Use the means.

subject: More about interior life
point:
'Man's life on earth is a warfare': so said Job many centuries ago.

There are still some easy-going individuals who are not aware of the fact.

subject: More about interior life
point:
That supernatural mode of conduct is a truly military tactic.

You carry on the war ﻿—﻿ the daily struggles of your interior ﻿—﻿ far from the main walls of your fortress.

And the enemy meets you there: in your small mortifications, your customary prayer, your methodical work, your plan of life: and with difficulty will he come close to the easily-scaled battlements of your castle. And if he does come, he comes exhausted.

subject: More about interior life
point:
You write: 'My joy and my peace. I will never have real happiness if I have not peace. And what is peace? Peace is something closely

related to war. Peace is a consequence of victory. Peace demands of me a continual struggle. Without a struggle I will never have peace.'

subject: More about interior life
point:
What depths of mercy there are in God's justice! For, in the judgments of men, he who confesses his fault is punished: and in the Judgment of God, he is pardoned.

Blessed be the holy Sacrament of Penance!

subject: More about interior life
point: 'Put on the Lord Jesus Christ', says Saint Paul to the Romans. It is in the Sacrament of Penance that you and I put on Jesus Christ and his merits.

subject: More about interior life
point:
War! 'War', you tell me, 'has a supernatural end that the world is unaware of: war has been for us…'

War is the greatest obstacle to the easy way. But in the end we will have to love it, as the religious should love his disciplines.

subject: More about interior life
point:
The power of your name, Lord! As a heading to my letter I had written, as always, 'May Jesus watch over you.'

And he replies: 'The "May Jesus watch over you" of your letter has already helped me out of more than one tight corner. May he also watch over all of you.'

subject: More about interior life
point:
'Now that our Lord is helping me with his usual generosity, I will try to respond by being even more "considerate" in my ways.

So you told me. And I had nothing to add.

subject: More about interior life
point: I wrote to you and said: I'm relying on you: you'll see what we can do…!' ﻿—﻿ What could we do, except rely on Him!

subject: More about interior life
point:
A missionary. ﻿—﻿ You dream of being a missionary. Another Francis Xavier… And you long to conquer an empire for Christ. Japan, China, India, Russia… the peoples of the North of Europe, or America, or Africa, or Australia?

Stir up that fire in your heart, that hunger for souls. But don't forget that you are more of a missionary 'obeying'. Geographically distant from those apostolic fields, you work both 'here' and 'there': don't you ﻿—﻿ like Xavier ﻿—﻿ feel your arm tired after administering baptism to so many?

subject: More about interior life
point:
You tell me, yes, that you want to. Very good: but do you want to as a miser longs for gold, as a mother loves her child, as a worldling craves for honours, or as a wretched sensualist seeks his pleasure ?

No? Then, you don't want to.

subject: More about interior life
point:
What zeal people put into their earthly affairs: dreaming of honours, striving for riches, bent on sensuality. Men and women, rich and poor, old and middle﻿—﻿ aged and young and even children: all of them the same.

When you and I put the same zeal into the affairs of our souls, we will have a living and operative faith: and there will be no obstacle that we cannot overcome in our apostolic undertakings.

subject: More about interior life
point: To you, who like sports, the Apostle's argument should appeal: 'All the runners at the stadium are trying to win, but only one of them gets the prize. You must run in the same way, meaning to win'.

subject: More about interior life
point: Recollection. Seek God within you and listen to him.

subject: More about interior life
point: Encourage those noble thoughts, those holy desires which are awakening in you… A single spark may start a conflagration.

subject: More about interior life
point: Apostolic soul: Jesus' intimacy with you ﻿—﻿ so close to him for so many years! ﻿—﻿ doesn't it mean anything to you?

subject: More about interior life
point: It's true that I always call our Tabernacle Bethany… Become a friend of the Master's friends: Lazarus, Martha, Mary. And then you won't ask me any more why I call our Tabernacle Bethany.

subject: More about interior life
point: You know that there are 'evangelical counsels.' To follow them is a refinement of Love. It is said to be the way of few. At times I feel it could be the way of many.

subject: More about interior life
point:
'Here is a man who started to build and was unable to finish!'

A sad commentary which, if you don't want, need never be made about you: for you possess everything necessary to crown the edifice of your sanctification: the grace of God and your own will.

subject: Lukewarmness
point: Fight against that weakness which makes you lazy and careless in your spiritual life. Remember that it might well be the beginning of lukewarmness… and, in the words of the Scripture, God will vomit the lukewarm out of his mouth.

subject: Lukewarmness
point:
It hurts me to see the danger of lukewarmness in which you place yourself when you do not strive seriously for perfection in your state in life.

Say with me: I don't want to be lukewarm! Confige timore tuo carnes meas, pierce thou my flesh with thy fear: grant me, my God, a filial fear that will make me react!

subject: Lukewarmness
point:
I already know that you avoid mortal sins. You want to be saved! But you are not worried by that constant and deliberate falling into venial sins, even though in each case you feel God's call to conquer yourself.

It is your lukewarmness that gives you this bad will.

subject: Lukewarmness
point: How little Love of God you have when you yield without a fight because it is not a grave sin!

subject: Lukewarmness
point: Venial sins do great harm to the soul. ﻿—﻿ Therefore God says in the Song of Songs: 'Catch the little foxes that make havoc of the vineyards'.

subject: Lukewarmness
point: How sad you make me feel when you are not sorry for your venial sins! For, until you are, you will not begin to live real interior life.

subject: Lukewarmness
point: You are lukewarm if you carry out lazily and reluctantly those things that have to do with our Lord; if deliberately or 'shrewdly' you look for some way of cutting down your duties; if you think only of yourself and of your comfort; if your conversations are idle and vain; if you do not abhor venial sin; if you act from human motives.

subject: Study
point: There is no excuse for those who could be scholars and are not.

subject: Study
point: Study. Obedience: non multa, sed multum ﻿—﻿ not many things, but well.

subject: Study
point:
You pray, you deny yourself, you work in a thousand apostolic activities, but you don't study. You are useless then unless you change.

Study ﻿—﻿ professional training of whatever type it be ﻿—﻿ is a grave obligation for us.

subject: Study
point: An hour of study, for a modern apostle, is an hour of prayer.

subject: Study
point: If you are to serve God with your mind, to study is a grave obligation for you.

subject: Study
point: You frequent the Sacraments, you pray, you are chaste, but you do not study. Don't tell me you're good: you're only 'goodish'.

subject: Study
point:
Formerly, since human knowledge ﻿—﻿ science ﻿—﻿ was very limited, it seemed quite feasible for a single learned individual to undertake the defence and vindication of our holy Faith.

To-day, with the extension and the intensity of modern science, the apologists have to divide the work among themselves, if they want to defend the Church scientifically in all fields.

You… cannot shirk this responsibility.

subject: Study
point:
Books: don't buy them without advice from a Christian who is learned and prudent. It's so easy to buy something useless or harmful.

How often a man thinks he is carrying a book under his arm, and it turns out to be a load of rubbish!

subject: Study
point:
Study. Study in earnest. If you are to be salt and light, you need knowledge, ability.

Or do you imagine that an idle and lazy life will entitle you to receive infused knowledge?

subject: Study
point: It is good to see you put such determination into your study provided, of course, you put the same determination into acquiring interior life.

subject: Study
point:
Don't forget that before teaching one must act. 'Coepit facere et docere,' the holy scripture says of Jesus Christ: 'He began to do and to teach.'

First, action: so that you and I may learn.

subject: Study
point: Work! When you feel the responsibility of professional work, the life of your soul will improve: and you will become more of a man, for you will lose your habit of 'picking holes' in everything.

subject: Study
point: Teacher: your keenness to know and practise the best method of helping your students to acquire earthly knowledge is undeniable. But don't forget that you must have the same keenness to know and practise the christian spiritual life, which is the only method of helping them and you to be better.

subject: Study
point:
Culture, culture! Very good: let us be second to none in striving for and possessing it.

But, culture is a means and not an end.

subject: Study
point: Student: form yourself in a solid and active piety, be outstanding in study, have a strong desire for the 'professional' apostolate. And with that vigour of your religious and professional training, I promise you rapid and far-reaching developments.

subject: Study
point: You worry only about building up your knowledge. And what you have to build up is your soul. Then you will work as you ought ﻿—﻿ for Christ. In order that he may reign in the world, there must be some people who, with their eyes fixed on heaven, seek to acquire prestige in all human activities, so that they can carry out quietly ﻿—﻿ and effectively ﻿—﻿ an apostolate within their professions.

subject: Study
point: Your indolence, your carelessness, your laziness, are easygoing cowardice ﻿—﻿ so your conscience tells you continually, ﻿—﻿ but they are not 'the way'.

subject: Study
point: As long as the opinion you expressed was orthodox there is no reason to be upset, even though the malice of whoever heard you caused him to be scandalized. For his scandal is pharisaical.

subject: Study
point: It's not enough to be learned, in addition to being a good Christian. If you don't correct the brusqueness of your character, if you make your zeal and your knowledge incompatible with good manners, I can't see you ever becoming a saint. And despite your learning ﻿—﻿ because of it ﻿—﻿ you should be tied in a stall, like a mule.

subject: Study
point:
With that self-satisfied air you are becoming an objectionable and repellent type, you are making a fool of yourself, and, what is worse, you are harming your apostolic work.

Don't forget that even mediocrities can sin by being pompous.

subject: Study
point:
Your very inexperience leads you to that presumption, to that vanity, to all that you imagine gives you an air of importance.

Correct yourself, please. Foolish and all, you might come to occupy a position of responsibility (it has happened more than once) and, if you are not convinced of your lack of ability, you will refuse to listen to those who have the gift of counsel. And it frightens me to think of the harm your mismanagement will do.

subject: Study
point:
Nonsectarianism. Neutrality. Old myths that always try to seem new.

Have you ever stopped to think how absurd it is to leave one's Catholicism aside on entering a university, a professional association, a cultural society, or Parliament, like a man leaving his hat at the door?

subject: Study
point:
Make good use of your time. Don't forget the fig tree cursed by our Lord. And it was doing something: sprouting leaves. Like you…

Don't tell me you have excuses. It availed the fig tree little, relates the Evangelist. that it was not the season for figs when our Lord came to it to look for them.

And barren it remained for ever.

subject: Study
point: Those who are engaged in business say that time is money. That seems little to me: for us who are engaged in affairs of souls, time is… glory!

subject: Study
point: I don't understand how you can call yourself a Christian and lead such an idle, useless life. Have you forgotten Christ's life of toil?

subject: Study
point:
'It seems' ﻿—﻿ so you say ﻿—﻿ 'as if every imaginable sin were awaiting the first idle moment. Why, idleness itself must be a sin!'

He who pledges himself to work for Christ should never have a free moment, because to rest is not to do nothing: it is to relax in activities which demand less effort.

subject: Study
point: Idleness is something inconceivable in a man who has the soul of an apostle.

subject: Study
point: Add a supernatural motive to your ordinary work and you will have sanctified it.

subject: Formation
point:
How frankly you laughed when I advised you to put the years of your youth under the protection of Saint Raphael: 'so that he'll lead you, like young Tobias, to a holy marriage, with a girl who is good and pretty and rich', I told you, jokingly.
